content.description: The Wedding Hall, Monica and Chandler have just said “I do,” and the photographer is taking the required pictures. First of Monica, Chandler, Ross and Joey.

content.speaker: Photographer
content.text: Great. (Takes a picture.) Great! Just give me a sec to change film.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I know I’m not supposed to know, but I do. And I’m so excited for you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? What’s going on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica’s pregnant!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! Is that why you guys had to get married?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys! I’m not pregnant.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah. (To Chandler) Slow swimmers? (Chandler looks at him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! What do you mean? You-you-you’re not pregnant?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You didn’t tell anybody I was did you?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! (Pause) I’ll be right back. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Photographer
content.text: Now why don’t we get a shot of just Monica and the bloody soldier.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, about that. Joey, you have to change before the party.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t! I-I don’t have any other clothes here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Find some! Please! Anything that doesn’t say I-I died tragically in France. (Joey leaves to find clothes.)

content.speaker: Photographer
content.text: Well then why don’t we see the bride and the groom and the bridemaids.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Phoebe and Rachel join Monica and Chandler on the altar.) Hey Mon, why did you tell the guys you weren’t pregnant?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because I’m not.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We found your test in the trash, if you’re not pregnant—(She sees Rachel shaking her head)—It’s because I am.
(Flash, the photographer takes a picture of Monica and Chandler’s stunned faces.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?! What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, I…I am with child. (Flash) And I didn’t want to say anything because it’s your day; I didn’t want to steal your thunder.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute! So you told people I was pregnant?! (Flash) Does this look like a conversation that I want to remember?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who’s the father?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t say.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t say because he’s famous.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, who is it?! (Phoebe rolls her eyes.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, come on, you have to tell us.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, okay. It’s James Brolin. James Brolin is the father of my baby.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: As in Barbara Streisand’s husband James Brolin?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! Well he never said that to me!

content.description: The Wedding Hall, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Photographer
content.text: Why don’t we have Monica step away and we’ll get Chandler and the bridemaids.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How about just the bridemaids?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know I am the groom right? I was told it was kinda big deal.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It is.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: For you. (Chandler leaves.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, thank you for doing that. I just can’t deal with this just quite yet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So instead you told me Monica was pregnant.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You said that she was, I just didn’t disagree with you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sneaky.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Photographer
content.text: Smile ladies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! (They smile and the picture is taken.) Oh by the way?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: James Brolin?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I know. I could only think of two names, him and Ed Begley Jr. and then I remembered he’s gay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ed Begley Jr. is not gay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?!

content.description: The Reception Hall, the party is in full swing.

content.speaker: Bandleader
content.text: Thank you very much! Ladies and gentlemen, it gives me great pleasure to introduce to you for the very first time, Mr. and Mrs. Chandler Bing!
(They enter.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Before we go out there I’ve got a present for ya.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, I’m going to put my hand in your pocket!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ve been taking dancing lessons.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, the last six weeks. I wanted this to be a moment you will never forget.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that is so sweet!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So? Would you care to join me in our first dance as husband and wife?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.
(They walk onto the dance floor and Chandler slips and almost falls.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know, it’s these new shoes, they’re all slippery.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, are you going to be able to do this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not well.
(They start dancing and Chandler starts slipping around.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, the good news is, I don’t think anyone’s looking at us.
[Cut to Phoebe and Rachel at their table.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, are you ready to talk about it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.
(Pause)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, we’ll talk about something else then.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Who’s the father?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh! Look honey y’know what? I haven’t told him yet, so until I do I don’t think I should tell anybody else.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. That’s fine. That’s fair. Is it Tag?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’m sorry. I’ll stop.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Is it Ross? It’s Ross isn’t it—Oh my God, it’s Joey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, stop it! I am not going to tell you until I tell him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah-hah! At least we know it’s a him.
[Cut to Joey entering wearing a preppy tennis outfit.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh sweet Lord.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry! Okay? I went down to the gift shop and it’s either this or a bathrobe! Look, what’s more important, the way I’m dressed or me being with you on your special day?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, I’m not even going to pretend I was listening. (Sees someone else.) Hey! Hey! (Goes over to that person.)
[Cut to the hallway outside the room, Ross is going to see which table he’s at and sees a beautiful woman doing the same thing.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. I’m uh, I’m Ross. I don’t, I don’t believe we’ve met. I’m Monica’s older brother.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Oh hi, I’m, I’m Mona from her restaurant.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! Hello uh, Mona from her restaurant. (He uses his card to mouth those words.) (Pause) Mona, wow what a, what a beautiful name.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: You think so? I’ve always kinda hated it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aw come on, Mona Lisa?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mona umm…Clickclocken. The famous botanist? Huh? Oh no she’s uh—well she’s dead now. No, supposedly she was once quite the hottie of the plant world.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Really?! Well see? I never knew about her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Linda Clickclocken. (Pause) So what uh, what-what table are you at? (She shows him.) Oh, uh me too.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh good. Now there’ll be someone there who likes my name.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes there will. (Mona leaves and Ross tries to find the same table.) Oh guess what, Molly Gilbert you’ve just been bumped up to table one. And if it’s all right with you I’m gonna take your place at table six—Martin Clickclocken.
[Cut back inside to Joey giving a beautiful woman a tennis lesson by standing behind her.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s better, now just bend your arms a little more. There you go. Okay, look straight ahead. Now this time I want you to really put your ass into it. (They do a practice swing and she really puts her ass into it.)
[Cut to Chandler sitting down near Joey as his mom walks over. His birth mother, not the mother who recently visited one of those clinics in Sweden.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Chandler darling! Look, my date has finally arrived. I’d like you to meet Dennis Phillips.

content.speaker: Dennis Phillips
content.text: Congratulations.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Dennis is a dear old friend and a fantastic lover.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bravo Dennis thanks for pleasing my mother so.

content.speaker: Dennis Phillips
content.text: Oh, I’m so sorry I missed the ceremony, I was stuck at auditions.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Oh yes, Dennis is directing a new Broadway show.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t believe we’ve met, Joey Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Dennis Phillips
content.text: Dennis Phillips

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, I’ve admired your work for years. You-you’ve done some really amazing stuff.

content.speaker: Dennis Phillips
content.text: Oh, thank you. Well if you’ll excuse me, I’m gonna go get myself a drink. Be back in a moment. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow Dennis Phillips! That’s great! How did you guys meet?

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Well, it’s a funny story.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Funny: ha-ha or funny: (Mimes blowing his brain out.)
[Time lapse. The band is finishing another song.]

content.speaker: Bandleader
content.text: Thank you, thank you very much. If everyone will please take your seats, dinner will be served.
(Ross starts looking for table six and finds out that it’s the kid’s table. He sees Mona sitting at another table.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Uh, I thought, I thought you were at table six.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: No, nine. (Shows him the card again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh see, before you uh, when you showed it to me you-you held it that way (he turns her hand upside down) which uh, which was misleading. Well I’m… (He goes at sits down at his new table and the kids stare at him.) Hello.
[Cut to the hallway, Chandler is putting tape on the bottom of his shoes.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler. Will you see if your mom can give my resume to Dennis Phillips? ‘Cause if I can get in a Broadway show then I would’ve done it all, film, television, and theater. The only think left would be radio, and that’s just for ugly people.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What size shoes do you wear?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, eleven, eleven and a half.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Great, because my shoes are giving me a little problem on the dance floor, can I borrow the boots from your costume?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, I don’t even really know where I left those. Sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Those aren’t eleven and a half.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay fine! I’m a seven! All right, I have surprisingly small feet. But the rest of me is good, I’ll show ya!
[Cut to Monica and Rachel at their table.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can you believe Phoebe got pregnant?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh y’know what honey? Let’s not talk about that right now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is so huge.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure, but come on, as big as your wedding?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course not nothing is. Between me and you…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …in this day and age how dumb do you have to be to get pregnant?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Y’know, sometimes you can do everything right, everyone can wear everything they’re supposed to wear, and one of those little guys just gets through!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know! Maybe they have tools.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well I-I talked to and uh, she’s definitely going to have this baby. Y’know, she said she was gonna raise it on her own.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, maybe that’s, maybe that’s really brave.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe. I just hope she realizes how hard it’s gonna be.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe she hasn’t really thought it through that well.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, there’s a lot to think about. I mean, how is she, how is she going to handle this financially? How is she going to juggle work? Does she realize she’s not going to have a date again for the next eighteen years?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-hmm. I’m just thinking about Phoebe; poor knocked up Phoebe.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Champagne?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yes! Thank you very much! (She grabs a glass, takes a sip, and realizes what she just did. She then tries to spit the champagne back into the glass without Monica noticing. It doesn’t work.) Oh that’s-that’s actually how the French drink it.
(Monica gasps.)

content.description: continued from earlier, only now Phoebe joins them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I just got off the phone with my lover, James Brolin…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, and apparently he is married to some singer, but he said he would leave her for me. And I said, “James, James Brolin, are you sure?” James Brolin said…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel’s really the one who’s pregnant.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! (deadpan) Why bother?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How do you feel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. I don’t know how I feel. This is all happening so fast. I have to make all these decisions that I don’t want to make. (Takes another sip of champagne and spits it back out) Somebody just take this away from me!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Calm down. Maybe you’re not pregnant.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: When I got pregnant with the triplets, I took that test like three times just to make sure.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Maybe it’s a false positive. Are you sure you peed on the stick right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How many ways are there to do that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m-I’m just saying, don’t freak out until you’re a hundred percent sure.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I’ll-I’ll take it again when I get home.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You-you gotta take it now. Come on, do it as a present to me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ll run out and get you one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you guys are so great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, wait a minute! Who’s is the father?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, she won’t tell us.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, come on it’s my wedding! That can be my present.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh—Hey, I just gave you peeing on a stick.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See? This is why you register.
[Cut to Ross at the kiddie table. He reaches for something and a fart noise emanates which causes the kids to laugh.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was the chair again! Okay? I’m not doing it! It what—look, I don’t—y’know what—eh-eh… (He walks away and goes over to Mona.) Hi.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, would you like to dance?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh great! (They get up to dance and Ross is interrupted by a little girl.)

content.speaker: Little Girl
content.text: Dr. Geller?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I wasn’t farting! (To Mona) Uh, a little game from our table. (To the little girl) Yes?

content.speaker: Little Girl
content.text: Dr. Geller, will you dance with me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh umm, well uh, maybe-maybe later. Right now, I’m about to dance with this lady.

content.speaker: Little Girl
content.text: Okay. (She drops her head in disappointment and walks away.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Ohhhh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, unless! Unless, uh this lady wouldn’t mind letting you go first.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I’d be happy to. (To Ross) You are very sweet.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes I-I am. In fact umm hey, why don’t we try it my special way? You can dance on my feet.

content.speaker: Little Girl
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? Hop on. (They start dancing and Mona sits down.) Is the pretty lady looking?

content.speaker: Little Girl
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Keep dancing.
[Cut to Chandler in the hallway practicing dancing and is doing it very well.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And the world will never know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Did you talk to Dennis about me yet?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I told him how talented you were. I told him all about Days Of Our Lives .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no! No! No! You don’t tell a Broadway guy that! Now he just thinks I’m a soap actor.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But you’re not just a soap actor. You are a soap actor with freakishly tiny feet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!
[Joey walks back inside just as Ross’s dance is finishing.]

content.speaker: Little Girl
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no, thank you Miranda.

content.speaker: Little Girl
content.text: Melinda!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. (Walks over to Mona.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: How cute was that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh, were you, were you watching?
(Another little girl walks over to him.)

content.speaker: Second Girl
content.text: Can I go next?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Of course you can! Hop on!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Okay, but I get to hop on after her. (Ross bites the air in response.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am so gonna score.

content.speaker: Second Girl
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I like your bow.
[Behind them, Joey goes up to the bandleader and interrupts the song.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’d like to propose a toast. To Monica and Chandler, the greatest couple in the world. And my best friends. Now, my when I first found out they were getting married I was, I was a little angry. I was like, (overly angry) “Why God? Why? How can you take them away from me?!” But then I thought back over all our memories together, some happy memories. (Does a fake laugh.) And-and there was some sad memories. (Starts to break down and cry.) I’m sorry. And-and some scared memories—Whoa! (He jumps back, startled.) Eh? And then, and then I realized I’ll always be their friend, their friend who can speak in many dialects and has training in stage combat and is willing to do partial nudity. (Starts to walk away, but realizes something.) Oh! To the happy couple!
[Time Lapse, the interrupted song is finishing.]

content.speaker: Bandleader
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was very nice Ashley.

content.speaker: Ashley
content.text: Can we do it again?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no. (Walks over to Mona again.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: So, is it my turn now?
(A large little fat girl walks over.)

content.speaker: Fat Girl
content.text: I’m next!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! (Recoils in horror.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Uh, that’s okay. You can dance with her first.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you-you sure? (She nods yes.) Okay. (To the girl) Okay. So what’s uh, what’s your name.

content.speaker: Fat Girl
content.text: Gert!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s, that’s pretty. (They start to dance and Gert tries to step on Ross’s feet, but he pulls them out of harm’s way.) Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What are you doing there Gert?

content.speaker: Gert
content.text: Dancing on your feet! Like the other girls did it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (Swallows hard.) Hop on Gert. (She does and Ross winces in pain.)

content.speaker: Gert
content.text: Why aren’t you moving your feet?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m trying. (He strains to move his feet.)

content.speaker: Gert
content.text: Faster! You’re not going fast enough!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe I should stand on your feet! (Gert’s shocked and Ross realizes what he said and tries to brush it off.)
[Cut to Joey going over to talk to Dennis Phillips.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So did you uh, happen to catch my toast up there?

content.speaker: Dennis Phillips
content.text: Oh my God, that was for my benefit?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’d like to think there was something for everyone. Look, I know you’re casting for this new show…

content.speaker: Dennis Phillips
content.text: Look umm Joey, I-I don’t think you’re quite right for this project.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, see that’s where you’re wrong. Whatever it is I can do it. And if didn’t see it up there, just-just try me.

content.speaker: Dennis Phillips
content.text: It’s an all Chinese cast. Can you be Chinese?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I’m not proud of this, but… (He turns around and starts to mess with his eyelids.)

content.speaker: Dennis Phillips
content.text: Oh my God! No-no-no! Please! Please! Don’t-don’t-don’t!
[Cut to Monica walking up to Chandler.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, are you ready to get back on the dance floor?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did it turn into sand?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh come on, I love this song! Come on, you’ll be fine. (She starts to walk towards the floor.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No, I won’t. Do you know why I took all those lessons? See, for the first time I didn’t want you to be embarrassed to be seen on the dance floor with some clumsy idiot.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh sweetie, you can never embarrass me. (Chandler grunts.) Okay, you can easily embarrass me. But come on, it doesn’t matter. All right? I married you! So I want to dance on my wedding night with my husband. Come on. (They go onto the floor.) Just try not to move your feet at all. (Chandler starts to get into the groove and bust a move.) There you go.
(Mr. Geller dances over.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Chandler, I’m gonna have you arrested.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: You stole my moves. (He starts to dance like Chandler was and Chandler stops.)

content.description: The Women’s Restroom, Rachel and Phoebe are waiting for the outcome of Rachel’s second test.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How much longer?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: 30 seconds.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: 30 seconds, okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did I miss it? (Phoebe nods no.) Rachel, I-I want you to know that, if it’s positive, we’re gonna…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh I know. I know. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s time.
(Another woman starts to enter.)

content.speaker: The Girls
content.text: No!! (The woman backs out.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Go ahead Rach.
(She goes over to look.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wait! Y’know what? I can’t, I can’t look at it. I can’t. Somebody else tell me, somebody tell me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, it’s negative.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s negative.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Oh. Well there you go. Whew! (Pause) That is—that’s great—that is really great-great news. (Pause) Y’know ‘cause the whole not being ready and kinda the financial aspects, all that. Whew. Wow, this is so just the way it was supposed to be. (Starts to cry.) God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well… Well, great.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Here. (Gives Rachel a tissue.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks. (Crying) God this is so stupid! (Pause) How could I be upset over something I never had? It’s negative?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, it’s positive.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s-it’s not negative, it’s positive.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well yeah, I lied before.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now you know how you really feel about it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh, that’s a risky little game!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you really gonna do this?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. I’m gonna have a baby. I’m gonna have a baby. I’m gonna have a baby! (They all hug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: With who?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah, it’s still not the time.

content.description: The Reception, Joey is helping Ross walk after Gert got through with him and Mona is looking on concerned.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just didn’t see the fast song coming.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shh. Shh. Don’t try to talk, we’ll get you up to your room, we’ll soak your feet, you’ll be okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thank you.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: That is so sweet!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: No, I mean it. There are so few genuinely nice guys out there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Tell me about it, I feel like I’m holding down the fort all by myself.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: It’s Joey right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute! No! I’m the nice one! I’m the one who danced with the kids all night! How…How small are your feet?! (They all look down.)
